etymologies: Old English steorfan ‘to die’, of Germanic origin, probably from a base meaning ‘be rigid’ (compare with stare); related to Dutch sterven and German sterben

definitions: (of a person or animal) suffer severely or die from hunger

examples.text: she left her animals to starve

shortDefinitions: suffer or die or cause to suffer or die from hunger

definitions: cause (a person or animal) to suffer severely or die from hunger

examples.text: for a while she had considered starving herself

shortDefinitions: cause person or animal to suffer severely or die from hunger

examples.text: I don't know about you, but I'm starving

definitions: force someone out of a place or into a specified state by stopping supplies of food

examples.text: the Royalists were starved out after eleven days
German U-boats hoping to starve Britain into submission

shortDefinitions: force someone out of place or into specified state by starvation

examples.text: the arts are being starved of funds
pull down that window for we are perfectly starving here
